meanings.definition: Having a backbone or spinal column.
meanings.sent1: The backboned fish swam gracefully in the water.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the backboned creatures in the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The backboned animals had a meeting to discuss their favorite swimming spots.
meanings.sent4: Her backboned determination helped her overcome all obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The backboned structure of the building provided stability during the storm.

meanings.definition: Having a strong and resolute character.
meanings.sent1: The backboned leader made tough decisions for the team.
meanings.sent2: She showed her backboned nature by standing up for what she believed in.
meanings.sent3: Even in the face of adversity, his backboned spirit never wavered.
meanings.sent4: The backboned attitude of the coach inspired the players to give their best.
meanings.sent5: Her backboned resolve carried her through the most challenging times.

meanings.definition: Supported by a backbone or central structure.
meanings.sent1: The backboned organization had clear hierarchies in place.
meanings.sent2: The backboned company thrived under strong leadership.
meanings.sent3: The backboned building stood tall amidst the surrounding structures.
meanings.sent4: The backboned framework of the project ensured its success.
meanings.sent5: The backboned support system kept the entire operation running smoothly.
